title: [Neuroscience] We Now Understand Why Mosquitoes Have an “Unbreakable” Ability To Smell Humans: A new study has discovered that mosquito olfactory neurons have multiple "fail-safe" sensing systems, a feature that explains why genomic efforts to stop mosquitoes smelling us have failed to til now

[Neuroscience] Research has found nearly 40% of older adults may experience brain damage caused by Limbic-predominant Age-related TDP-43 Encephalopathy (LATE), a form of dementia that is often mistaken for Alzheimer’s disease
